author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...FLOSSIE FORECAST TO BECOME A HURRICANE TONIGHT OR TUESDAY... ...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL POSSIBLE ALONG COASTAL SOUTHWESTERN MEXICO...
summary: ...FLOSSIE FORECAST TO BECOME A HURRICANE TONIGHT OR TUESDAY... ...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL POSSIBLE ALONG COASTAL SOUTHWESTERN MEXICO... As of 3:00 PM CST Mon Jun 30 the center of Flossie was located near 16.2, -103.6 with movement NW at 12 mph. The minimum central pressure was 996 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 65 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...FLOSSIE FORECAST TO BECOME A HURRICANE TONIGHT OR TUESDAY... ...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL POSSIBLE ALONG COASTAL SOUTHWESTERN MEXICO... As of 3:00 PM CST Mon Jun 30 the center of Flossie was located near 16.2, -103.6 with movement NW at 12 mph. The minimum central pressure was 996 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 65 mph.

title: Summary - Tropical Storm Flossie (EP1/EP062025)
